channel.title: Blog.jetbrains.com on .NET Ramblings
channel.description: Recent content in Blog.jetbrains.com on .NET Ramblings

item.title: Compose Multiplatform 1.7.0 Released
item.description: Compose Multiplatform is a declarative UI framework built by JetBrains that allows developers to share UI implementations across different platforms. The 1.7.0 release brings more components to common code, support for type-safe navigation, significant performance improvements on iOS, and changes from the latest Jetpack Compose update. Here are the highlights of this release: For the [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/kotlin/2024/10/compose-multiplatform-1-7-0-released/

item.title: Join Us for JetBrains Plugin Developer Conf 2024
item.description: Hey everyone! We‚Äôre introducing JetBrains Plugin Developer Conf 2024, the first-ever virtual event dedicated to plugin development for JetBrains products! We invite you to join us on Thursday, November 7 for a full day of engaging sessions and insightful discussions.¬†This conference brings together JetBrains experts and plugin developers to explore topics such as developing [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/platform/2024/10/join-us-for-jetbrains-plugin-developer-conf-2024/

item.title: Ktor 3.0 Is Now Available With New Features and Improved Performance
item.description: This new version uses Kotlin 2.0 and switches to kotlinx-io, making Ktor more up to date and better connected with other Kotlin tools. Ktor 3.0 works faster and gives you more options for building client-server applications. If you‚Äôre new to Ktor or need a reminder about how it works, our recent blog post, Ktor 101: [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/kotlin/2024/10/ktor-3-0/

item.description: The new CLion 2024.3 EAP build, 243.19420.28, is out. You can download it for free from the link below, via the Toolbox App, or as a snap package if you‚Äôre using Ubuntu. item.title: Online Coding Workshop for the C++ Basics Course
item.description: Join us on Tuesday, October 22, 2024, at 3:00 pm UTC (check other timezones) for our free online workshop for the C++ Basics course. item.title: How I do Django APIs in PyCharm
item.description: I learn so much from watching conference talks, especially live, when I‚Äôm vibing with the crowd. But sometimes I watch and think: ‚ÄúWow, I wish I could show you how awesome that would be in PyCharm.‚Äù That just happened. Here‚Äôs the explainer, with a little special something at the end. Hello, DjangoConf I recently attended [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/pycharm/2024/10/how-i-do-django-apis-in-pycharm/

item.title: IntelliJ IDEA 2024.3 EAP 5: Extended Support for Kotlin Features, Updates to Find in Files, Option to Disable Pre-Commit Checks, and More
item.description: The IntelliJ IDEA 2024.3 EAP 5 is here!¬†You can now download this version from our website, update directly from within the IDE, use the free Toolbox App, or install it via snap packages for Ubuntu.¬†Download IntelliJ IDEA 2024.3 EAP 5 If you haven‚Äôt seen our earlier overviews of the latest features, browse through [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/idea/2024/10/intellij-idea-2024-3-eap-5/

item.title: A Joint Bugfix Release for Five Recent MPS Versions Is Out
item.description: We‚Äôre releasing updates for MPS 2022.2, 2022.3, 2023.2, 2023.3, and 2024.1, with numerous fixes included. In general, it‚Äôs safe to assume that all features and bug-fixes from the releases of older MPS versions have been included in the newer ones. DOWNLOAD MPS 2024.1.1 There are two new features worth mentioning separately: Filter commented out nodes [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/mps/2024/10/mps_joint_bug_fixreleases/

item.title: Fleet 1.41 Is Here With New Bundled Keymaps, Unlimited Splits, Improved Typing Latency and Editor Responsiveness, and Many More Enhancements
item.description: Fleet 1.41 is now available! Explore our latest release, which introduces many new features designed to improve your development experience. You can update to this version using the Toolbox App. Let‚Äôs take a closer look at the highlights. Download Fleet 1.41 New features Improvements Bug fixes We‚Äôve also fixed several bugs: See the full release [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/fleet/2024/10/fleet-1-41-is-here-with-new-bundled-keymaps-unlimited-splits-improved-typing-latency-and-editor-responsiveness-and-many-more-enhancements/

item.title: Qodana 2024.2 Release: Enhanced Android Linter, Hard-coded Password Detection, and More
item.description: Get ready for new features and improvements with our latest Qodana 2024.2 release! This update introduces major enhancements that boost security, extend compatibility, and provide more convenience for development teams looking to increase code quality. Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs new: View Qodana 2024.2 Documentation Hardcoded password detection Hardcoded passwords can be a critical security issue because, when [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/qodana/2024/10/qodana-2024-2-release/

item.title: TeamCity Pipelines Is Now Out of Beta
item.description: In March 2024, we announced the Beta release of TeamCity Pipelines, a new approach to CI/CD that offers blazing-fast pipelines to optimize your development flow. After six months of fine-tuning, adding features, and gathering feedback, we‚Äôre excited to announce that TeamCity Pipelines is officially going GA (General Availability) üéâ This is a major milestone for [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/10/teamcity-pipelines-out-of-beta/

item.title: Where To Get Data for Your Data Science Projects
item.description: Whether you‚Äôre starting a new project or expanding an existing one, as a data scientist, you‚Äôre always on the lookout for new material to explore. Knowing where to get data for data science projects can be challenging, and finding ‚Äúgood data‚Äù can be even more difficult. In this article, we‚Äôll look at what makes ‚Äúgood [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/pycharm/2024/10/how-to-get-data/
